question: Compounds P and R in the following reaction are:
$CH_{3}CHO \xrightarrow[(ii)H_{3}O^{+ }]{(i)CH_{3}MgBr} P \xrightarrow[heat]{conc H_{2}SO_{4}} Q \xrightarrow[(ii)H_{2}O_{2}/OH^{-}]{(i)B_{2}H_{6}} R$
explanation: P is Propan-2-ol and R is Propan-1-ol.
These differ in the position of the -OH group, making them position isomers.
